Class Encryption

java.lang.Object
RepeatedMethods
Encryption
public class Encryption extends RepeatedMethods

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Encryption​(String choice)
    Constructor that creates a new file to write the encrypted message on or Wipes a file that already exists to rewrite onto.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    encryptFile()
    Method that will take the key and its starting position, and the message and go letter by letter encrypting the message following the key Once the message has been encrypted it writes out the encrypted message to a previously given file It will also update the starting position in the key file so it can be used for decryption
    void
    getKey()
    Method that will ask user for the key file and then get the starting position and the key from the file
    void
    getMessage()
    Method to get the message to encrypt from the user Has user type in the message then uses a method from abstract class to check for invalid characters.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Encryption

      public Encryption​(String choice) throws IOException
      Constructor that creates a new file to write the encrypted message on or Wipes a file that already exists to rewrite onto.
      Parameters:
      choice - String that sees if they want to create new file or overwrite an existing one
      Throws:
      IOException

  • Method Details

    • getMessage

      public void getMessage()
      Method to get the message to encrypt from the user Has user type in the message then uses a method from abstract class to check for invalid characters.

    • getKey

      public void getKey() throws IOException
      Method that will ask user for the key file and then get the starting position and the key from the file
      Throws:
      IOException

    • encryptFile

      public void encryptFile() throws IOException
      Method that will take the key and its starting position, and the message and go letter by letter encrypting the message following the key Once the message has been encrypted it writes out the encrypted message to a previously given file It will also update the starting position in the key file so it can be used for decryption
      Throws:
      IOException
